summary: The Supreme Court of India has issued notices to the State of Jammu and Kashmir and two doctors on appeals against a High Court ruling that the appointment of three doctors as Assistant Professors in the Medical Education Department of the State of Jammu and Kashmir was illegal. summary: The Rajasthan High Court has granted leave to Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati University to challenge the decision of the Division Bench of the High Court that it cannot be said with certainty that the answers to six questions given in the answer keys were erroneous and incorrect. We are of the view that the fresh evaluation by feeding correct key answers to the six questions in relation to which the appellants have sought re-evaluation, may have adverse impact on the admissions already granted on the basis of the results declared and ranking given by feeding incorrect keys in relation to these questions. We are of the view that the appellants or intervenors or even those who did not approach the High Court or this Court cannot be made to suffer on account of errors committed by the University.

summary: The appellant Surinder Singh @ Shingara Singh was convicted and sentenced to undergo imprisonment for life by a special CBI court at Panchkula in the state of Punjab on 6 September, 2005. The Supreme Court of India has dealt with several cases on the issue of speedy trial. In Dharampal v State of Punjab, the Punjab and Haryana High Court in Dharampal's case observed:- "We are of the opinion that the practice of releasing the accused on bail in cases where special leave has been granted to the accused to appeal against his conviction and sentence, is, therefore, absolutely essential that the practice which this Court has been following in the past must be reconsidered and so long as this Court is not in a position to hear the appeal of an accused within a reasonable period of time, the Court should ordinarily, unless there are cogent grounds for acting otherwise, release the accused on bail in cases where special leave has been granted to the accused to appeal against his conviction and sentence."
